function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Monitoring indoor air quality is crucial for avoiding the spread of COVID-19","Impact":"Risk of COVID-19 spread due to poor indoor air quality","Mitigation":"Implementing effective ventilation and air filtration systems","Technologies":"Smart ventilation systems, HEPA filters","People":"Building occupants, particularly in crowded indoor spaces","Owner":"Building owners and facility managers"},{"Description":"Configurable quantity and types of sensors may lead to inadequate coverage for monitoring key parameters","Impact":"Limited ability to detect and mitigate situations affecting thermal comfort and air quality","Mitigation":"Standardizing sensor configurations based on space requirements and occupancy levels","Technologies":"Sensor network optimization algorithms","People":"Designers and installers of monitoring systems","Owner":"Building designers and managers"},{"Description":"Complexity in programming the monitoring platform may lead to operational errors","Impact":"Inaccurate data collection and analysis, leading to ineffective responses to indoor environmental conditions","Mitigation":"User-friendly programming interfaces and automated error detection systems","Technologies":"Intuitive software interfaces, error-checking algorithms","People":"System administrators and maintenance personnel","Owner":"Building operators and maintenance teams"}]}
